intro: Austrobryonia, commonly known as the rock wallaby-rush, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its wiry, grass-like appearance. The plants typically grow in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Austrobryonia species are often found in heathlands and shrublands, where they contribute to the ecological diversity. Their small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or green, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of their habitat.
